meanings.definition: (植物学) 雄しべが2組に分かれている状態、またはそのような植物群
meanings.english_definition: (botany) A class of plants in the Linnaean system, having stamens united by their filaments into two bundles or sets; also, any plant of this class.

examples.sentence: The pea family, Fabaceae, exhibits diadelphia.
examples.translation: マメ科植物は、二体雄蕊を示します。

etymology.value: From Greek δί- (di-, "two") + ἀδελφός (adelphos, "brother"), referring to the two brotherhoods or groups of stamens.
